history.proof: intros p q H. unfold LockServ_network_network_invariant in *. destruct H as [H1a [H1b [H1c H1d]]]. split. - intros H3 H4. apply H1a; auto. - split. + intros H3 H4. apply H1b; auto. * shelve. * shelve. + split. * intros H3 H4. apply H1c; auto. -- shelve. -- shelve. * intros H3 H4. apply H1d; auto.

exceptions.exn: Wrong bullet +: Current bullet + is not finished.
Wrong bullet *: Current bullet * is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
num_Clients: nat

Goal:
forall p q : packet, LockServ_network_network_invariant p q -> LockServ_network_network_invariant q p

Premises:
LockServ_network_network_invariant = fun p q : packet => (pBody p = Unlock -> pBody q = Unlock -> False) /\ (pBody p = Locked -> pBody q = Unlock -> False) /\ (pBody p = Unlock -> pBody q = Locked -> False) /\ (pBody p = Locked -> pBody q = Locked -> False) : packet -> packet -> Prop
Record packet (P : BaseParams) (params : MultiParams P) : Type := mkPacket { pSrc : name; pDst : name; pBody : msg } Arguments packet {P params} Arguments mkPacket {P params}
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : nat, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Net.packet_eq_dec : forall p q : packet, {p = q} + {p <> q}
network_invariant_maintained_deliver_old : forall (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)) (p q : packet), net_handlers (pDst p) (pSrc p) (pBody p) (sigma (pDst p)) = (out, st', ps) -> state_invariant sigma -> network_invariant sigma p -> network_invariant sigma q -> network_network_invariant p q -> network_invariant (update name_eq_dec sigma (pDst p) st') q where ?B : [num_Clients : nat |- BaseParams] ?M : [num_Clients : nat |- MultiParams ?B] ?Decomposition : [num_Clients : nat |- Decomposition ?B ?M]

Record Decomposition (B : BaseParams) (M : MultiParams B) : Type := Build_Decomposition { state_invariant : (name -> data) -> Prop; network_invariant : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop; network_network_invariant : packet -> packet -> Prop; network_network_invariant_sym : forall p1 p2 : packet, network_network_invariant p1 p2 -> network_network_invariant p2 p1; state_invariant_init : state_invariant init_handlers; state_invariant_maintained_input : forall (h : name) (inp : input) (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)), input_handlers h inp (sigma h) = (out, st', ps) -> state_invariant sigma ->...-> distinct_pairs_and network_network_invariant (map (fun m : name * msg => {| pSrc := pDst p; pDst := fst m; pBody := snd m |}) ps) } Arguments Build_Decomposition _ _ (_ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
valid_unlock = fun (q : list Client_index) (h : bool) (c : Client_index) (p : packet) => pSrc p = Client c /\ (exists t : list Client_index, q = c :: t) /\ h = false : list Client_index -> bool -> Client_index -> packet -> Prop Arguments valid_unlock _%list_scope _%bool_scope
valid_locked = fun (q : list Client_index) (h : bool) (c : Client_index) (p : packet) => pDst p = Client c /\ (exists t : list Client_index, q = c :: t) /\ h = false : list Client_index -> bool -> Client_index -> packet -> Prop Arguments valid_locked _%list_scope _%bool_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Build_Decomposition : forall (B : BaseParams) (M : MultiParams B) (state_invariant : (name -> data) -> Prop) (network_invariant : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop) (network_network_invariant : packet -> packet -> Prop), (forall p1 p2 : packet, network_network_invariant p1 p2 -> network_network_invariant p2 p1) -> state_invariant init_handlers -> (forall (h : name) (inp : input) (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)), input_handlers h inp (sigma h) = (out, st', ps) -> state_invariant sigma -> state_invariant (update name_eq_dec sigma h st')) ->...-> Decomposition B M
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fix eqb (n m : N) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0%N => match m with | 0%N => true | N.pos _ => false end | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => false | N.pos q => (p =? q)%positive end end : N -> N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope

Nat.le_alt = fun n m : nat => exists p : nat, p + n = m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.le_alt (_ _)%nat_scope

packet_eq_dec : forall p1 p2 : packet, {p1 = p2} + {p1 <> p2}
StepDup_dup : forall (net net' : network) (p : packet) (xs ys : list packet), nwPackets net = xs ++ p :: ys -> net' = {| nwPackets := p :: xs ++ p :: ys; nwState := nwState net |} -> step_dup net net' []
StepFailure_deliver : forall (net net' : network) (failed : list name) (p : packet) (xs ys : list packet) (out : list output) (d : data) (l : list (name * msg)), nwPackets net = xs ++ p :: ys -> ~ In (pDst p) failed -> net_handlers (pDst p) (pSrc p) (pBody p) (nwState net (pDst p)) = (out, d, l) -> net' = {| nwPackets := send_packets (pDst p) l ++ xs ++ ys; nwState := update name_eq_dec (nwState net) (pDst p) d |} -> step_failure (failed, net) (failed, net') [(pDst p, inr out)] where ?P0 : [num_Clients : nat |- BaseParams] ?P : [num_Clients : nat |- MultiParams ?P0] ?params : [num_Clients : nat |- FailureParams ?P]

step_failure_sind : forall P : list name * network -> list name * network -> list (name * (input + list output)) ->...-> P p p0 l where ?P0 : [num_Clients : nat |- BaseParams] ?P : [num_Clients : nat |- MultiParams ?P0] ?params : [num_Clients : nat |- FailureParams ?P]

Nat.left_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, n < z -> A (S n) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, n <= z -> A n

nw_nw_distinct_pairs_and_elim : forall (xs : list packet) (a b : packet) (ys l : list packet), l = xs ++ a :: ys -> In b (xs ++ ys) -> distinct_pairs_and network_network_invariant l -> network_network_invariant a b where ?B : [num_Clients : nat |- BaseParams] ?M : [num_Clients : nat |- MultiParams ?B] ?d : [num_Clients : nat |- Decomposition ?B ?M]
state_invariant_maintained_input : forall (h : name) (inp : input) (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)), input_handlers h inp (sigma h) = (out, st', ps) -> state_invariant sigma -> state_invariant (update name_eq_dec sigma h st') where ?B : [num_Clients : nat |- BaseParams] ?M : [num_Clients : nat |- MultiParams ?B] ?Decomposition : [num_Clients : nat |- Decomposition ?B ?M]
post_input_analyze_sent_packet : forall (h : name) (p : packet) (ms : list (name * msg)) (l : list packet), In p (map (fun m : name * msg => {| pSrc := h; pDst := fst m; pBody := snd m |}) ms ++ l) -> In (pDst p, pBody p) ms /\ h = pSrc p \/ In p l
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
LockServ_network_invariant = fun (sigma : name -> data) (p : packet) => locks_correct_unlock sigma p /\ locks_correct_locked sigma p : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop Arguments LockServ_network_invariant _%function_scope
Nat.add_lt_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> n + p < m + p

```  
intros p q H.
unfold LockServ_network_network_invariant in *.
unfold LockServ_network_network_invariant.
intros H1 H2.
destruct H as [H1a [H1b [H1c H1d]]].
split.
- intros H3 H4.
  apply H1a; assumption.
- split.
  + intros H3 H4.
    apply H1b; assumption.
  + split.
    * intros H3 H4.
      apply H1c; assumption.
    * intros H3 H4.
      apply H1d; assumption.
```
